title: How to Ship Items Sold on eBay

steps.title: Pack your item so that it won't rattle or break, depending on what you are shipping, for example if you sold a fragile piece of ceramic or glass you would need bubble wrap and Styrofoam.
steps.content: Pack your item so that it won't rattle or break, depending on what you are shipping, for example if you sold a fragile piece of ceramic or glass you would need bubble wrap and Styrofoam.

steps.title: If you have PayPal, after you make the sale log in to your PayPal account and go to account history you will see the payment you received from the buyer a few columns to the right it will say "Print Shipping Label" - when you click that, it will bring you to a screen where you confirm the address, the weight dimensions and the service you would like to ship with and then they prompt you to print the label.
steps.content: If you have PayPal, after you make the sale log in to your PayPal account and go to account history you will see the payment you received from the buyer a few columns to the right it will say "Print Shipping Label" - when you click that, it will bring you to a screen where you confirm the address, the weight dimensions and the service you would like to ship with and then they prompt you to print the label.

steps.title: Tape the shipping label to the box covering the whole label with tape.
steps.content: Tape the shipping label to the box covering the whole label with tape.

steps.title: Take it to a trading post or a post office.
steps.content: Take it to a trading post or a post office.

steps.title: Send the tracking label to your customer.
steps.content: Send the tracking label to your customer.

steps.title: TIP:
steps.content: TIP: You may want to use old newspaper for the packing. Close it and see if anything rattles when shaken. Very nicely use clear packing tape, found everywhere basically, and seal all open ends. Good luck!
